greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = floor(n/sqrt(k)) for 1 <= k <= n^2, read by rows.
link: Jason Kimberley, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10416 (the first 31 rows of the triangle)
example: The first five rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[Floor[n/Sqrt@ k], {n, 7}, {k, n^2}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 24 2016 *)
program: /* Print initial five rows of triangle as follows: */
results.author: _Jason Kimberley_, Nov 09 2016
